text: I carefully curate the photos and content I post online.
I present a more idealized version of myself on social media.
I often edit or filter my photos before posting.
I avoid posting content that could reflect poorly on me.
My online profile represents who I truly am.
I use emojis, GIFs, or memes to express emotions online.
I'm more comfortable expressing myself in writing than speaking.
I frequently comment or engage on other people's posts.
I prefer private messages over public comments.
I adapt my tone and language depending on the platform or audience.
I often share personal experiences or opinions publicly online.
I'm conscious of what information I share and who sees it.
I use different usernames or accounts to separate parts of my life.
I've regretted something I posted online.
I frequently review my privacy settings.
I feel more connected to people online than in real life.
I maintain friendships primarily through digital communication.
I feel anxious when people don't respond to my messages quickly.
I've formed meaningful relationships through online platforms.
I compare myself to others based on their social media.
I check my social media multiple times a day.
I follow people or accounts that inspire or entertain me.
I prefer platforms where I can control how I present myself.
I enjoy experimenting with new online platforms or tools.
I use different platforms for different purposes (e.g., work vs. fun).
